simulator.method

Class SPRTMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulator.method.SimulationMethod
      • simulator.method.SPRTMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class SPRTMethod
extends SimulationMethod
    SimulationMethod class for the SPRT (Sequential probability ratio test) approach, as used by Younes/Simmons (CAV'02). See also Younes/Kwiatkowska/Norman/Parker (TACAS'04) and Vincent Nimal's MSc thesis.

        Parameters:

        beta - Probability of type II error
        delta - Indifference parameter

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Reset the status of this method (but not values of any parameters that have been set). Typically called if this instance is going to be re-used for another run of approximate verification.
        Specified by:
        reset in class SimulationMethod

      • computeMissingParameterBeforeSim

        public void computeMissingParameterBeforeSim()
                                      throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Compute the missing parameter (typically there are multiple parameters, one of which can be left free) *before* simulation. This is not always possible - sometimes the parameter cannot be determined until afterwards. This method may get called multiple times.
        Specified by:
        computeMissingParameterBeforeSim in class SimulationMethod
        Throws:
        PrismException - if the parameters set so far are invalid.

      • setExpression

        public void setExpression(Expression expr)
                   throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Set the Expression (property) that simulation is going to be used to approximate. It will be either an ExpressionProb or ExpressionReward object. All constants should have already been defined and replaced.
        Specified by:
        setExpression in class SimulationMethod
        Throws:
        PrismException - if property is inappropriate somehow for this method.

      • computeMissingParameterAfterSim

        public void computeMissingParameterAfterSim()
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Compute the missing parameter (typically there are multiple parameters, one of which can be left free) *after* simulation. (Sometimes the parameter cannot be determined before simulation.) This method may get called multiple times.
        Specified by:
        computeMissingParameterAfterSim in class SimulationMethod

      • getMissingParameter

        public java.lang.Object getMissingParameter()
                                     throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Get the missing (computed) parameter. If it has not already been computed and this can be done *before* simulation, calling this method will trigger its computation. If it can only be done *after*, an exception is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getMissingParameter in class SimulationMethod
        Returns:
        the computed missing parameter (as an Integer or Double object)
        Throws:
        PrismException - if missing parameter is not and cannot be computed yet or if the parameters set so far are invalid.

      • getParametersString

        public java.lang.String getParametersString()
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Get the parameters of the simulation (including the computed one) as a string.
        Specified by:
        getParametersString in class SimulationMethod

      • shouldStopNow

        public boolean shouldStopNow(int iters,
                             Sampler sampler)
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Determine whether or not simulation should stop now, based on the stopping criteria of this method, and the current state of simulation (the number of iterations so far and the corresponding Sampler object). Note: This method may continue being called after 'true' is returned, e.g. if multiple properties are being simulated simultaneously.
        Specified by:
        shouldStopNow in class SimulationMethod
        Parameters:
        iters - The number of iterations (samples) done so far
        sampler - The Sampler object for this simulation
        Returns:
        true if the simulation should stop, false otherwise

      • getProgress

        public int getProgress(int iters,
                       Sampler sampler)
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Get an indication of progress so far for simulation, i.e. an approximate value for the percentage of work (samples) done. The value is a multiple of 10 in the range [0,100]. This estimate may not be linear (e.g. for CI/ACI where 'iterations' is computed). It is assumed that this method is called *after* the call to shouldStopNow(...). Note: The iteration count may exceed that dictated by this method, e.g. if multiple properties are being simulated simultaneously. TODO: check methods for this
        Specified by:
        getProgress in class SimulationMethod
        Parameters:
        iters - The number of iterations (samples) done so far
        sampler - The Sampler object for this simulation

      • getResult

        public java.lang.Object getResult(Sampler sampler)
                           throws PrismException
        Description copied from class: SimulationMethod
        Get the (approximate) result for the property that simulation is being used to approximate. This should be a Boolean/Double for bounded/quantitative properties, respectively.
        Specified by:
        getResult in class SimulationMethod
        Parameters:
        sampler - The Sampler object for this simulation
        Throws:
        PrismException - if we can't get a result for some reason.

        Get an explanation for the result of the simulation as a string.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
